content.rendered:
Despite a little rain, Kelsey and Dylan's classic, romantic wedding at The Bridge Building was as sweet as could be.

After meeting through a mutual friend, fate stepped in to handle the rest.

An adorable first look on the rooftop kicked off the day. The aisle was lined with white rose petals and rustic arrangements filled with white blooms and branches framed the altar. Blush draping added effortless romance, cloaking the space in a soft, warm glow.

Following the ceremony, the wedding party braved the wild weather with clear bubble umbrellas in hand for some gorgeous photos on the Pedestrian Bridge.

Guests noshed on gourmet grilled cheese sandwiches, chef-carved BBQ brisket, gourmet french fries and trio of salads stations for dinner.

In true Nashville fashion, the couple danced for the first time as husband and wife to "Millionaire" by Chris Stapleton.

To end the evening in style, guests lit up the night with glow sticks to send the couple off to their waiting getaway car, a stunning 1963 Rolls Royce.

Get your scroll on for more from this classic romantic wedding.

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: March 8, 2019
Bride & Groom: Kelsey & Dylan
Location: The Bridge Building
Guest Count: 204
Colors: Navy, White & Gold
Photographer: Matt Andrews Photography
Paper Goods: Ink Spot
Florist: Flower Express
Calligraphy: Shelby Reece Design
Draping: Quest Events
DJ:  Nashville Party Authority
Catering & Bar: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Infinity Hospitality
Planning: Knestrick by Design

excerpt.rendered: A classic, romantic wedding with pops of navy blue at The Bridge Building.
